favourite.article: When we reach the end of our hoarded resources, our Fatherâ€™s full giving is only begun.
Praise the Lord for His riches!
In my reading last evening I enjoyed James 4:6, it reminded me of this song. Always happy to find songs that match the Word I am enjoying. This morning I enjoyed Annie Johnson Flints's biography.
According to Ravi Zaccharias, these words were written by a woman afflicted with several burdensome maladies.
Does anyone know where this tune originated from?
He giveth more grace, meaning He gives more of Himself to us. Wonderful our God is.
James 4:6 "But He gives all the more grace...." Onward. In His Will CCM Aaron McClain The Salvation Army of Augusta

Thank the Lord for such a love He has for all His children. May He continue to have much mercy on each of us that we grow to maturity, to be over overcomers, to be those expressing HIM in all aspects of our living.

In the church life we cannot go on without the grace of the Lord Jesus. That's why we need to be a proper vessel so that we can receive His grace. Though it is grace, still there is the need of our willingness in the matter of receiving it.
This song has blessed my heart for many years, and it's one of my favorites! Thank you so much for posting it.
Beautiful song. Indeed there is no limit to His power.
To God be the glory for social network that made me to come across this song that I sang last over 30 years ago. It is refreshing and reassuring. Praise be to God.

I'm preparing a lesson on Grace based on 1 Corinthians 15:9-10; I 'm using several other scriptures too and Ephesians 2:7-9 is one of them. I haven't sung this song for 30 or 40 years. It is one of the first songs I sang as a soloist. It came to my mind tonight but I couldn't remember the words. The Internet is so wonderful to have at our fingertips. Lord thank You for Your Word that inspired this song.

After sharing the word of God by revelation knowledge on a broadcast with a pastor from Dallas, he said you have more knowledge on grace than I do and this song came in my spirit, so I looked it up. We'll try to share it with others in the Dallas area this weekend.

Just last night, in fellowshiping with a believer that the Lord brought recently connected me with, this song came to me. Yet I couldn't recall all of the tune. So I called another sister in Illinois. The two of us in Oregon huddle close to the phone while this sister sang the first verse and chorus and then we joined in on the second. We all were refreshed by touching the Lord in our spirit together. Thank You Lord Jesus for Your wonderful supply thru the universal Body of Christ!
I enjoyed the comment below of Kathy Hodges. Praise the Lord dear sister, what a wonderful family we are! We love You, Our Father.

Who can out do God! No one! There is no God except the Creator of heaven, earth and everything between. That's why this song is so powerful. The God of the universe is God all by Himself! No rivals! No contest! Hence, He is able to supply all our needs when our finite resources that He gave us anyway, is all gone. What a God!

Wow!! Learned this hymn as a small child. Hadn't thought of it in years. Happened to pick up an old devotional book and it was printed there. Looked online and am amazed at the comments from litterly "around the entire world". What A great family of believers I belong to. God Bless you ALL wherever you may be.

A friend with young children has her husband suddenly struck with brain haemorrhage and in a hospital and this song came to my mind when I was praying for her...Thank God for hymns and for His spirit that continues to minister to His children thru the hymns... What a blessing!!

As I put the final touches to Sunday's message entitled 'Giving to the Giver of all good gifts', this song came to mind to quote. A dear friend, who is now with the Lord often used to sing the song as a solo. Precious memories.

I grew up with this hymn and some of the words came into my mind a few minutes ago. I googled it to get all the words. Then I discovered believers all over the world who are also blessed by this hymn. Wow! Thank you for posting; we are connected in Him!
I searched out this woman's testimony - what a precious knowing and believing in Christ. Her poems and hymn writing really capture our own Christian experiences. Thank You Lord for giving more grace.
This song really pulls me through during my hardest times. :)

Amen. How encouraging it is to read through this hymn and read the saints' comments. It shows that we're all going through trials and afflictions. We're not alone! And also, we can all testify that God's grace is poured out on us, sweetly, in these times of trials to heal our soul. Lord, we praise You! And saints, let's stay open to Him as much as we can, so that He can pour Himself into us unhindered.
Beautiful and meaningful song.

This is my best hymn ever. Learnt it from the Salvation Army Song Book. It's a song that lifts my spirit and even got me more moved when I read the story of the writer of the song. Powerful song, man!
This hymn is very beautiful and powerful, thank you my Lord.

I'm tired of the thing which I'm encountering recently . Thank the Lord for this hymn; when we reach the end of our hoarded resources, Father's full giving is only begun. Lord, in multipled trials, Your multiplied peace in me.

He giveth more grace as the burdens grow greater! May the Lord supply each and every member of the Body of Christ as they go through trials and the burdens grow greater! The Lord uses every experience of life in a way that we would turn to Him and gain Him in a fresh and living way.
PRAISE THE LORD!

Where would we turn if we did not have the Lord to sustain us with His loving grace during our times of trials and setbacks. He truly gives us more grace when the burdens grow greater. We sang this hymn in church Sunday and I knew I needed to find a copy of the lyrics for my Bible study time. What a God we have!

I really love this song! It's really our experience. It shows us that we are not really like Him because our love is limited and we are so limited in giving. OH LORD JESUS! Give me more grace that I may express Your divine attributes in my human virtues. I'm really short of You. I love You, Lord Jesus.
I am so exhausted by everything that has been going on recently. But thank the Lord that He giveth more grace when the burdens grow heavier. He giveth and giveth and giveth again!!
What has really touched me is to know the background of the songs that I am blessed by. This song was written by a dear soul that was very ill and confined to bed with terrible disabilities.

I am young and full of love to the Lord. This song is very touching to me. His grace, his mercy and peace toward us is exceedingly wonderful! We need to enjoy the Lord in a practical way. By calling on his name, singing a hymn to him, reading the bible, praying, or preaching the gospel. By this way the Lord will make his home in our hearts and we will be filled with his love! Praise the Lord saints!
What a wonderful grace has given to us. Grace is Christ Himself. Praise the Lord, I need more of grace, which is You amen!
It's midterm week, and my strength has certainly "failed ere the day is half done." But praise the Father that his full giving's only begun! Hallelujah for his grace!
Praise the Lord for such a grace! This can be enjoyed by us, it has no measure! His love no limit. Thank You Father!
I love this song! It has become one of my favorites!! God does giveth more grace to us!

This song really touched me because the Lord's love has no limit, His grace has no measure. Oh how much the Lord loves us! Even though the Lord loves us so much, but how much do we love the Lord? Oh Lord Jesus! It was such a reminder to me that we should daily consecrate ourselves to him and just love him more and more each day!

I love this song because it is very subjective to our experience of Lord in daily life. Most of time, we live in our mind according to our natural man. We use our natural patience and endurance to deal with our problems and eventually it runs out. But then as we get exposed, the Lord starts to work in us to be our real strength and power to overcome our situations. How we need enjoy the Lord as grace!
I like this song because i can sing along with it :) and i can also be more in my spirit when i listen to this. I love it a lot.
I like this song because the way I sing it I encourage myself to receive His grace more and more.
I like this song because it just relaxes me and makes me feel really good. I like when it says "His love has no measure." He always loves us.

This song is a REALLY experiential and motivational song to me for all seasons. Whenever I experience greater or increased burdens in my situations, I will simply remember that the Lord gives me MORE grace! That He will never forsake me no matter what, whenever I faithfully commit matters unto Him. And I can still remember to praise and thank the Lord for His wonderful grace in the midst of the big or small burdens/labors which are coming my way every now and then. Praise the Lord for His bountiful and unlimited grace bestowed on me!
I like this song, because it tells me that God keeps on giving and giving, and we don't deserve it and I thank Him for it.
I really enjoy this song because it gives me encouragement and strength for the day. Praise the Lord, He never stops giving of His grace.
